intro: Geniostoma, commonly known as the "spearhead plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often spiny leaves that give it a unique appearance. The flowers are typically small and clustered in composite heads, which are a hallmark of the Asteraceae family. Geniostoma species are native to various regions in Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. These plants are adapted to withstand drought conditions, making them resilient in harsh climates.
